summary: This bill, HR 3982, establishes the "Tariff Response And Damages to Exports Fund" (TRADE Fund). The President can deposit tariff revenues from imported agricultural products (Harmonized Tariff Schedule chapters 1-24) into this fund. The Secretary of Agriculture will then use the funds to assist agricultural producers impacted by export competition, reduced market access, or trade-related disruptions. The Secretary must report annually to relevant congressional committees on fund revenues, economic impacts, and assistance provided. The TRADE Fund expires on September 30, 2030.
